comment: Smart Data Models - Transportation / Road Segment adapted to DTDL from smartdatamodels.org. Source: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/smart-data-models/dataModel.Transportation/master/RoadSegment/schema.json
description: This entity contains a harmonised geographic and contextual description of a road segment. A collection of road segments are used to describe a Road.

contents.name: alternateName
contents.comment: An alternative name for this item

contents.name: areaServed
contents.comment: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided

contents.name: color
contents.comment: The color of the product

contents.name: dataProvider
contents.comment: A sequence of characters identifying the provider of the harmonised data entity.

contents.name: dateCreated
contents.comment: Entity creation timestamp. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: dateModified
contents.comment: Timestamp of the last modification of the entity. This will usually be allocated by the storage platform.

contents.name: description
contents.comment: A description of this item

contents.name: endKilometer
contents.comment: The kilometer number (measured from the road's start point) where this road segment ends.

contents.name: image
contents.comment: An image of the item

contents.name: length
contents.comment: Total length of this road segment in kilometers

contents.name: maximumAllowedHeight
contents.comment: Maximum allowed height for vehicles transiting this road segment

contents.name: maximumAllowedSpeed
contents.comment: Maximum allowed speed while transiting this road segment. More restrictive limits might be applied to specific vehicle types (trucks, caravans, etc.)

contents.name: maximumAllowedWeight
contents.comment: Maximum allowed weight for vehicles transiting this road segment

contents.name: minimumAllowedSpeed
contents.comment: Minimum allowed speed while transiting this road segment

contents.name: name
contents.comment: The name of this item.

contents.name: source
contents.comment: A sequence of characters giving the original source of the entity data as a URL. Recommended to be the fully qualified domain name of the source provider, or the URL to the source object.

contents.name: startKilometer
contents.comment: The kilometer number (measured from the road's start point) where this road segment starts.

contents.name: totalLaneNumber
contents.comment: Total number of lanes offered by this road segment

contents.name: width
contents.comment: Road's segment width.

contents.name: allowedVehicleType
contents.comment: Vehicle type(s) allowed to transit through this road segment. Enum:'agriculturalVehicle, bicycle, bus, car, caravan, carWithCaravan, carWithTrailer, constructionOrMaintenanceVehicle, lorry, moped, motorcycle, motorcycleWithSideCar, motorscooter, tanker, trailer, van, anyVehicle'. Allowed values: The following values defined by _VehicleTypeEnum_, [DATEX 2 version 2.3](http://d2docs.ndwcloud.nu/):

contents.name: annotations
contents.comment: Annotations about the item

contents.name: category
contents.comment: Allows to convey extra characteristics of a road segment. Enum:'oneway, toll, link'.  `oneway`: Flags whether the road segment can only be used in one direction. If not present it means road segment can be used in both directions (forwards and backwards). See also [http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:oneway](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:oneway). `toll` : Flags whether the road segment is under toll fees. `link` : Flags whether this road segment is an auxiliary link segment for exiting or enteri

contents.name: laneUsage
contents.comment: This attribute can be used to convey specific parameters describing each lane. It must contain a string per road segment lane. The element 0 of the array must contain the information of lane 1, and so on. Format of the referred string must be: <lane_direction>, <lane_minimumAllowedSpeed>, <lane_maximumAllowedSpeed>, <lane_maximumAllowedHeight>, <lane_maximumAllowedWeight>. <lane_direction> is a text string with the following allowed values: `forward`. The lane is currently used in the `forwards` direction.

contents.name: owner
contents.comment: A List containing a JSON encoded sequence of characters referencing the unique Ids of the owner(s)

contents.name: address
contents.comment: The mailing address
